title: @Riot, I want to say something about U.R.F.
body:
I love it. I never played the first iteration but it's a blast, and it's really sad to see that the boards are full of posts complaining about U.R.F. even though it has only been out one day.

Just wanted to say I appreciate that you quietly polished up and re-released a fan-favorite mode. It's sad to see that so many people who were clamoring for the return of U.R.F. are already complaining about you guys delivering it to us. We can all agree that U.R.F has some balance issues, but I just want to let you guys know that many of us players actually appreciate that you guys brought back U.R.F., and we thank you for it.

replies.body:
Offering a balanced game experience isn't really what URF is about (or NURF for that matter). We do try to do that with SR, and occasionally we are successful. :)

URF and other game modes are about offering a different experience when you want to play League but also want something different. It's like going to your favorite restaurant and ordering the special of the day instead of that favorite order that you'll always go back to.

The team made some effort this year to make sure ridiculously OP champs aren't present every single game, but we also expect that players will get better at "solving" URF as time goes on and more champs will rise to the top. That's okay. If you want a more balanced game, that's what SR if for.
Hey can I ask you something? I know Rioters generally have thick skin, but did it hurt when people started complaining about URF not being fun after a year of 'URF OR RIOT!'?

Agreed. There are definitely certain champs that are much better than others in ARAM, but it's ok because ARAM is for taking a break from all the stress that can build up when you play SR all day, and that's what alternate game modes are for, offering a different experience that may not be balanced but are instead fun and refreshing.
But don't you balance TT, CS & HA too?

I like urf a lot. Wasn't around for it last time. I just wish people would be a bit more adventurous, and a bit less annoying, with their picks.

I wasn't clamoring for URF's return. I'm glad Riot did it; it was fun. I *definitely* don't want it to be a permanent mode, though.

> so many people who were clamoring for the return of U.R.F. are already complaining about you guys delivering it to us. 

I really don't think the people complaining are the same people who clamored for its return. I'm friends with a lot of the "clamorers" and we're all having a blast.

I think it's possible to love URF and still note its flaws, even if a lot of the complaints here feel a tad one-sided. Even after the meta solidified, and after people realized some champions were super-broken and started overplaying them, URF is still incredibly fun, and that's something that needs to be said more, but there are still ways it can improve, and that still needs to be pointed out (though in a constructive manner).
